description: Using 3D projections, life-like holograms, and live magicians, this is the first time audiences can marvel at the greatest illusions up close – all in a socially distanced setting. Conceived by British high-tech magician, Jamie Allan (iMagician), this experiential exhibit blends Jamie’s encyclopedic knowledge on the history of magic with state-of-the-art technology to bring illusions of the past into the 21st century. You and your Magic Circle (of wizards you live with) will explore a labyrinth of mysterious rooms transporting you to different eras of illusion. Take an immersive journey through the evolution of magic as the world’s most famous illusionists share their deepest secrets…

reviews.title: Fun for adults
text: Cool stuff, illusions, trying to figure out how they do it still, without searching online.  But a really fun option for a night out.

reviews.title: A Day of Magic
text: I took my grandchildren to Illusionarium and was completely happy with their interest and response. They range in age from 7 to 18 and each one of them found the whole show entertaining. I was extremely impressed with the friendliness, courtesy, and care the staff gave to our large group. Yes I would recommemd Illusionarium to all families for a day out in  this vibrant city.

reviews.title: Nothing up their sleeves, including talent
text: I can't understand the positive reviews that some people gave this show,  as it was a big disappointment in my opinion. The "performers" were lack-luster, and the tricks were amateur level at best. I was tempted to commend the hostess who escorted us, for being able to act so enthusiastic, as without her clapping and woot-woot after each performance, you could only hear crickets.  I've been fortunate to have seen Copperfield, Penn and Teller, Chris Angel and Siegfried and Roy live, and wasn't expecting that caliber of magic, but I also didn't expect it to be on the level of what you would see at a children's birthday party. As others have said, they did a good job in making my $100 disappear, but that's about it.

reviews.title: What a mistake
text: This was terrible. False advertising. Can't believe Penn and Teller and any other names were attached to this.  I've seen better acts on the subway, and despite extensive use of tv screens, actual TV at home has better shows.  I feel sorry for the employees and magicians here that have to take this seriously when they're probably well aware that it's a cash grab that will never be recommended or praised. Awkward as heck for a date, just cringy.  Not a slice of Vegas. Hope these kinds of exhibits stay out of Toronto.

reviews.title: Definitely worth seeing!
text: After seeing a news interview highlighting the Illusionarium.  I bought tickets right away.  I've always been a fan of magic and illusions. When my family and I went to the illusionarium, we were not disappointed!  WOW!  We had such an amazing experience, The different rooms available touched each of us in a different way!  Definitely a destination to add to your bucket list when planning a trip to Toronto! Thank you all for putting this together for us!

reviews.title: Watching tv screen is not a show
text: Don't spend money on this. There is almost no show, most of the time you watch a tv screen. They show you 4 real real person on stage illusions and the rest is crap, you just watch a movie with magic tricks.
Don't waste your time and money. Typical Toronto scam

reviews.title: Astonishing from start to finish. Highly recommended! 5 stars.
text: I was in the city for business and myself and my colleagues finished early and we were gifted the VIP package by our clients for a job well done. Two of our group fancied themselves as ‘magicians’ so were very excited at this bonus, and what a bonus it was! We were privileged to get to see The Secret Chamber, and none of us could believe we could see something so thrilling that close up. That was worth the price of admission right there. Our guide was great and super knowledgeable, embarrassed to say I cannot remember his name, only he was from Scotland or Ireland! Loved the trick we all got to do with Penn and Teller. The whole experience for us was about 90 mins with a visit to the shop. Can’t wait to do the iPhone tricks with my children. We didn’t have any children in our group, but I know if we had, they’d have given the whole experience 5 stars too. Brilliant. Sublime. Astonishing! Thank you. We’ll be back with family and friends.

reviews.title: must see for any magic enthusiast and fan of the history of magic
text: This is a must see for any magic enthusiast and fan of the history of magic. I personally love anything history and found it all fascinating, that being said, it is great for kids as well. There is quite a bit of video, which was really educational.  The interactive card trick with Penn & Teller was really cool and the metamorphosis illusion was wild! Loved it!

reviews.title: Big disappointment
text: Despite the best efforts of the staff that worked there who did a good job, it was not a good experience.

A lot of “fluff”, big advertisements and big promises but very little content. A lot of videos about the history of magic with very little actual magic. Not interactive at all. The few magic tricks were very old and basic, nothing new or exciting. They focused more on room decorations and fancy screens than on showing magic and illusions. The whole thing was about one hour (including transition time from room to room). It was definitely not worth the overpriced ticket and $40 parking. Not recommended.

reviews.title: Incredible Immersive Magical Experience - Don't Miss it!
text: Jamie Allen's Illusionarium is a fantastic immersive experience that is also great for families and kids. On arriving, you climb the staircase up to the coat check area where you are surrounded by amazing artwork on the walls and floating top hats. It immediately sets the scene for what is to come. All of the magicians were superb and I have never seen anything like this, not even in Las Vegas. One of my favorite rooms was the Secret Chamber with the water escape which I have to admit was very intense and certainly keeps your heart pounding throughout. The Penn & Teller illusion was fantastic and it truly felt like the magic was happening right in my hands. The Evo-lusion Theatre with its LED Screens will satisfy those that love their modern technology and is a wonderful finale to 90 mins of magic that simply passed too quickly. They have gone to great lengths to make everyone feel safe during these Covid times and the guides who escorted us through the experience were simply outstanding. From floating hats, water escapes, holograms of Houdini and more, I promise you will have never experienced anything like Illusionarium. It is definitely not to be missed!

reviews.title: Not worth the money, trick failed and they just sent us home with a mask.
text: For the price you expect live people doing magic.  Everything was screen generated or voiceover the magician that seemed incredibly strange and unprofessional.  The one live magician was not good, the youngest kid could spoil all his tricks.  The diver they lock in the tank was good but their clock runs fast…The last “grand finale” trick failed, completely, and they sent everyone into the hallway.  A guy waiting to do the VIP tour was there and was kind enough to do card tricks to entertain us.  It was probably the best thing we saw and it wasn’t part of the tour. They then exited us out the gift shop without an explanation or offering to redo the trick, but gave us a free COVID face mask for not getting the big trick.   This was unbelievably disappointing for adults and kids/teens alike.  It is way too much money for what you got.

reviews.title: Good effort but a bit pricey for what it is
text: Good effort but a bit of a let down given the admission price. If you have kids who are into magic, could be fun. My teen thought it was ok but probably best for younger kids. There was a lot of talk and museum like artifacts and info. Limited on the real live magic except at the end for 2 impressive tricks. I liked the pod organization that allows for good social distancing while still feeling interactive. Not sure I can recommend it too highly but filled a good hour we had free in the afternoon.

reviews.title: Not worth going
text: If you are in circle 11 or 12 you can’t see anything.  You are at the back of a long skinny room.  A good 50 feet from the stage at the front.  Acts were not exciting from the little bit that we could see.  There are a lot of old films but they don’t add any value.  The 1 out of the 5 rooms that was fun was the Penn & Teller room…..there is an activity and each circle has its own monitor to watch.  Don’t know if upgrading to VIP tickets would make any difference.

reviews.title: Not worth 100.00
text: If you are really into magic you will find this informative (but you may already know about these things).
Honestly, a little tack at times, not overly well executed. Some fun moments.
Too expensive for the experience. Should be no more than 60.00

reviews.title: expert magicians! clever idea! were rushed through! note: not worth the VIP upcharge
text: Engaging idea, cleverly executed. This show was clearly created with a love of magic!
Our magic-loving family gives it 3.5 stars out of 5.
Average but not stellar -- here is why:
1. Needed to be longer. Even just one more "stop".
2. Relies a lot on film -- ideally replace with actual magic acts.
3. Rather wobbly. We progressed through the exhibit without flow (perhaps seemed disparate because our guide was nervous).
4. Very expensive.
The VIP upcharge was NOT worth it. For the extra price got a small poster, VIP badge, and a few tricks in a small office space (but with velvet drapes).
The illusions were fun, but overall it was a expensive, average attraction.

reviews.title: LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT
text: Illusionarium is by far the best magic spectacle I've ever seen. The magicians are so professionals they make you feel like you're in a movie. My 7 year old was so mesmerized by the show that even bought a bunch of souvenirs to impress his friends.

reviews.title: A truly magical experience
text: What a magical experience! From start to finish, the show captured me in a world like no other! As a magic lover, it showed me all the things I already love about it, and so much more. I highly recommend this experience to anyone who loves magic, or is looking for something fun to do with their friends/family.

reviews.title: Illusionarium
text: It needs more magic tricks. Less film more acts
Very expensive for what it was. Would not recommend.

reviews.title: Fascinating and entertaining experience
text: We had a great time at this fascinating interactive experience, a really interesting and entertaining journey through the history of illusions. Can highly recommend.

reviews.title: Disillusioned! Worst show ever!
text: The worst show ever! It doesn’t matter what seats you reserve, you’re  assigned a random number to locate seats in different rooms where they bore you, mostly with videos. First you crowd around in a group for an amateur card trick then your host ushers you to each room. Stalling for time as they make sure the group before is done. The host has great energy but is often ahead of the group and can’t be heard. That energy is extremely annoying as they gasp dramatically and are the first and loudest to clap at every... umm... “trick?” It doesn’t feel like there are any magicians involved, the location and actors are lacklustre and underwhelming. The biggest illusion was where our money went.

reviews.title: Magical!
text: I had low expectations, but I was really impressed about this pop-up and can’t wait to attend the next one! :)

reviews.title: My kids and I could do a better show than this in our garage!! And better effects and sounds.
text: Horrible experience. DO NOT GO TO THIS SHOW!! It is the cheesiest, cheapest, low budget, gawdiest show you will ever see. Save your money. There is nothing impressive about this show at all. Terrible actors, unknown magicians, yes all 3 of them in total. Ridiculous "immersive experience" just a dumb card trick my 8 year old could have shown. Save your money, Toronto should be embarrassed to be supporting such a scam and a tacky show like this. Millions of other things to do in this great city. THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM!!

reviews.title: Horrible Experience
text: We love magic shows and have seen quite a few all over the world.

Illusionarium project in Toronto is extremely disappointing and deceiving "no name" event which consists of walking through a few halls in a miserable facility, watching documentaries available online, looking at the posters and 3 very basic tricks performed by either amateurs or students ( looked like whoever was available that day - no names were given).
I would certainly ask for a full refund if I could.

reviews.title: Shout out to our guide Robert
text: Our tour guide, Robert, made the experience completely. Entertaining, funny and a joy to watch. He even showed us an extra trick once the show was over. 10/10! If you go into this performance with an open mind and appreciate the work put into the production, it's a fabulous experience!

reviews.title: The Magic is Happening
text: This is an amazing show! Great sets, magnificent performers and interactive. We really enjoyed this.

reviews.title: Missing the magic.
text: The magic happened! $200 disappeared from my wallet and all I got for it was an amateurish, non-immersive show, short on information and totally lacking in either figurative or literal magic. The Penn and Teller "trick" was simply pathetic. On a positive note, the 4-year old with us enjoyed it.

reviews.title: Show me the Magic!
text: Took my son with me to see this show. Overall it was pretty well done. Obviously Covid has driven this type of show design, and they have done a great job. Just be nice to see more magic with less talk? The magic we did see was excellent and the water part is Amazing!!!

reviews.title: Not worth the money
text: Paid the extra $100 for the family to have the VIP experience and it was NOT worth the money. The only difference between basic and VIP is that VIPs sit upfront (all the rooms are not big so all seats are good) and the VIPs after the show go to a small room to see a street performer do 3 card tricks. Honestly, paying $200 for the basic family pass wouldn't even be worth it. Not enough live performances. It is 97% virtual/videos which are all about the history of magic. Go watch Greg Frewin in Niagara Falls. That's a magic show.
